channel.title: Months
channel.description: Day By Day VA Family-Literacy Calendar

item.title: May Monthly Activities
item.description:
Books to Read!

• How Do Dinosaurs Learn Their Colors? by Jane Yolen and Mark Teague
• Play and Learn: Colors by Roger Priddy
• A Color of His Own by Leo Lionni
• My Very First Book of Colors by Eric Carle
• White Rabbit's Color Book by Alan Baker
• Bear Sees Colors by Karma Wilson and Jane Chapman
• Monsters Love Colors by Mike Austin
• Mouse Paint by Ellen Stoll Walsh
• The Day the Crayons Quit by Drew Daywalt and Oliver Jeffers
• Duck and Goose Colors by Tad Hills
• The Color Kittens by Margaret Wise Brown, Alice Provensen, and Martin Provensen
• Spot's Favorite Colors by Eric Hill
• Sky Color by Peter H. Reynolds
• Elmer's Colors by David McKee
• Blue Hat, Green Hat by Sandra Boynton
• Coat of Many Colors by Dolly Parton and Judith Sutton
• Edible Colors by Jennifer Vogel Bass
• Red Lace, Yellow Lace by Mark Casey, Judith Herbst, and Jenny Stanley
• Are You Ready To Play Outside? by Mo Willems
• Can I Play Outside? by Matthew Price and Atsuko Moro Zumi
• Mrs. Piggle Wiggle by Betty MacDonald and Alexandra Boiger
• Playing Outside With Kitty by C. D. Shelton
• The Grouchy Ladybug by Eric Carle
• The Poky Little Puppy by Janette Sebring Lowrey
• Slither Slide, What's Outside? by Nora Hilb, Simon Shapiro, and Sheryl Shapiro
• Color Farm by Lois Ehlert
• Mommy Hugs by Anne Gutman and Georg Hallensleben
• I Love My Mommy Because . . . by Laurel Porter Gaylord and Ashley Wolff
• Mommy Calle Me Monkeypants by J. D. Lester and Hiroe Nakata
• I Love You, Mommy by Jillian Harker and Kristina Stephenson

Artwork by Patrick Girouard iREAD 2014 Summer Reading Program

Around VA

Check out Festivals and Events happening in May around the state.

  • The Bodacious Spring Bazaar and Wine Festival - Hampton
  • Roanoke Strawberry Festival - Roanoke
  • 2015 First Firday Spring Art Walk - Martinsville
  • Chincoteague Seafood Festival - Chincoteague
  • Richmond Pet Expo - Richmond
  • Montpelier Wine Festival - Montpelier Station
  • Heart of Virginia Festival - Farmville
  • Blacksburg Spring Bazaar - Blacksburg
  • Spring Town Point Virginia Wine Festival - Norfolk
  • Wytheville Spring Farmers Market - Wytheville
  • Family Fun Day - Toano
  • Chantilly Big Flea Market - Chantilly
  • Wings, Wheels, and Crafts - Brodnax
  • Ladysmith Day Festival - Ladysmith
  • Spring Expo Yard Sales and Market - Fishersville
  • 2015 Richmond Arts In the Park - Richmond
  • South Hill Spring Fest - South Hill
  • Town Center Craft and Beer Festival - Virginia Beach
  • Ridgeway Springfest - Ridgeway
  • Spring Shenandoah Antiques Expo - Fishersville
  • Gosports Arts Festival - Portsmouth
  • Amelia Day Festival - Amelia
  • Virginia Spring Renaissance Faire - Spotsylvania
  • Crozet Spring Arts and Craft Festival - Crozet
  • Fort Clifton Arts and Crafts Festival - Colonial Heights
  • McLean Day - McLean
  • Strasburg Mayfest - Strasburg
  • Martinsville Bead, Gem, Mineral, and Jewelry Show - Martinsville
  • Chesapeake Jubilee - Chesapeake
  • Danville Festival In the Park - Danville
  • Fredericksburg Greek Festival - Fredericksburg
  • 2015 Chantilly International Gem and Jewelry Show - Chantilly
  • Northern Virginia Fine Arts Festival - Reston
  • Trail Days Festival - Damascus
  • Petersburg Super Chevy Show - Petersburg
  • Virginia Beach Spring Town Fair - Virginia Beach
  • 7th Annual Warbirds Over the Beach - Virginia Beach
  • 4th Annual Chantilly Day - Chantilly
  • Virginia Wine and Craft Festival - Front Royal
  • Stockley Gardens Spring Arts Festival - Norfolk
  • Old Town Warrenton Spring Festival - Warrenton
  • Virginia Beer Festival - Norfolk
  • Virginia Renaissance Faire - Spotsylvania
  • BBQ At Sedalia - Big Island
  • Fieldale Heritage Festival - Fieldale
  • 28th Annual Taste of Arlington - Arlington
  • Roanoke Valley Gem, Mineral, and Jewelry Show - Salem
  • Memorial Day Weekend Flea Market - Hillsville
  • Umoja Festival - Portsmouth
  • Downtown Roanoke Festival In the Park - Roanoke
  • Staunton Art In the Park - Staunton
  • Plumb Alley Day - Abingdon
  • Virginia Renaissance Faire - Spotsylvania
  • 2015 Pungo Strawberry Festival - Virginia Beach
  • Jubilee In the Breaks - Breaks
  • Virginia Beach Surf Art Expo - Virginia Beach
  • Gathering In the Gap Music Festival - Big Stone Gap
  • Viva Vienna Festival - Vienna
  • Herndon Festival - Herndon
  • Clinch River Days Festival - Saint Paul
  • 42nd Annual Quilt Show - Chantilly
  • Blackbeard Pirate Festival - Hampton
  • Richmond Spring Beer, Bourbon, and BBQ Festival - Richmond
  • Arts In the Middle - Urbanna
  • Spotsylvania Virginia Renaissance Faire - Spotsylvania
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: May 31
item.description:
Sing a Song

Quiet Cats

We are little pussy cats
(use hands, crawl, or tip toe)
Walking round and round.
We have cushions on our feet
(whisper)
And never make a sound.

You can change the lyrics to be other animals such as dogs, elephants, crocodiles, and any other animals you can think of!

TumbleBooks

The Journey of Oliver - K. Woodman

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Help your child write a letter to a family member or friend describing the animals he or she has seen this month. Younger children can dictate and then draw a picture of one of the animals.

Watch

PBS Kids: Snow Leopard-ish

Explore More

  • Animal House - Sing along with this catchy tune!
  • Farm Animals - Learn more about farm animals on a real farm in Colorado.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: May 30
item.description:
Sing a Song

Itty Bitty Fishes

There were some itty bitty fishes
In an itty bitty pool
There was a momma fish
A daddy fish
A baby fish too
They swam and they swam just as fast as they can
And they swam themselves right over the dam.

TumbleBooks

Scaredy Squirrel - Melanie Watts

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Talk with your child about the names of baby animals: kitten, puppy, lamb, colt, etc.

Watch

Barnyard Babies

Explore More

  • Names of Baby and Groups of Animals - Did you know that a baby pig is a shoat and a baby kangaroo is a joey? Find out more baby animals names.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: May 29
item.description:
Sing a Song

There Was a Little Turtle

There was a little turtle, (make a small circle w/hand)
He lived in a box, (make box w/hand)
He swam in a puddle (wiggle hands)
He climbed on the rocks. (stack hands on the other)
He snapped at a mosquito, (clap hands)
He snapped at a flea, (clap hands)
He snapped at a minnow, (clap hands)
He snapped at me. (clap hands)
He caught the mosquito, (clap hands)
He caught the flea, (clap hands)
He caught the minnow, (clap hands)
But he didn’t catch me! (shake index finger)

TumbleBooks

Diary of a Fly - Doreen Cronin

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Make thumb print animals together!

Watch

Desert Doves

Explore More

  • Make a Turtle Costume - Transform a cardboard box into a turtle shell and a fun game!
  • The Hare and the Tortoise - Now you can hear the famous story from the rabbit’s perspective. Be sure to click on the audio above the story.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: May 28
item.description:
Sing a Song

Higgledy Piggledy

Higgledy Piggledy,
My black hen,
She lays eggs
For gentlemen;
Sometimes nine,
And sometimes ten,
Higgledy Piggledy,
My black hen!

TumbleBooks

Louise, The Adventures of a Chicken - Kate Di Camillo

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Talk about how eggs come from chickens. Decorate an egg with markers. Don’t forget to use it before it spoils!

Watch

Chicken Little

Explore More

  • Paper Cup Chicken Craft - You can make a chicken that really clucks!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: May 27
item.description:
Sing a Song

Pussy Cat Pussy Cat

Pussy Cat Pussy Cat where have you been?
I’ve been to London to visit the queen.
Pussy Cat Pussy Cat what did you there?
I frightened a little mouse under her chair!

TumbleBooks

A Platypus, Probably - Sneed B. Collard

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Read an animal book today! Some suggestions are Head to Toe or The Very Hungry Catepillar by Eric Carle.

Watch

The Little Red Hen

Explore More

  • Backyard Bird Feeder - Here is an easy bird feeder to make with items around the house. Be sure to draw pictures of the birds that come to feed!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: May 26
item.description:
Sing a Song

Five Little Robins

Five little robins lived in a tree.
A father, a mother, and babies three.
Father caught a worm,
Mother caught a bug,
This one got the bug,
This one got the worm,
And this one sat and waited for his turn.

TumbleBooks

Duck! Rabbit! - Amy Krouse Rosenthal

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Ask your child what animal he or she would be and why?

Watch

Penguin Party

Explore More

  • Make a Book About Penguins - Print these pages and cut out for a fun do-it-yourself book all about penguins.
  • Creature Feature: Emperor Penguins - Learn more about this species of penguins, see pictures, watch a video of emperor penguins and their babies, and more!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: May 25
item.description:
Sing a Song

One, One, the Zoo is Lots of Fun

One, one,
The zoo is lots of fun

Two, two,
See a kangaroo

Three, three,
See a chimpanzee

Four, four,
Hear the lions roar

Five, five,
Watch the seals dive

Six, six,
There's a monkey doing tricks

Seven, seven,
Elephants eleven

Eight, eight,
A tiger and his mate

Nine, nine,
Penguins in a line

Ten, ten,
I want to come again!

TumbleBooks

Little Hoot - Amy Krouse Rosenthal

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

L. Frank Baum, the man who wrote The Wizard of Oz was born this month. Draw a picture of the lion!

Watch

Can A Flea Climb a Tree?

Explore More

  • Zoo Arts & Crafts - Here are several art projects to try. You can make zebra stripes with a marble, spots on a giraffe, thumbprint monkeys, and more!
  • Paper Plate Lion Craft - Make a lion with a curly mane. If you want, make eyeholes for a lion mask.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: May 24
item.description:
Sing a Song

Did You Ever See a Bunny

Tune: Did you Ever See a Lassie

Did you ever see a bunny,
a bunny, a bunny.
Did you ever see a bunny,
That hops up and down?
He hops on his right foot,
And hops on his left foot.
Did you ever see a bunny
That hops up and down?

Here are some more words to try!
…that twitches her nose?
She looks up and twitches
And looks down and twitches…

…that nibbles his food?
He nibbles on carrots
And nibbles on lettuce…

..that wiggles her ears? (use hands)
She wiggles them forward
And wiggles them backward…

TumbleBooks

Meet the Meerkat - Darrin Lunde

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Take turns pretending to be different animals and guess which animal the other person is pretending to be!

Watch

One Little Rabbit

Explore More

  • Paper Plate Bunny Craft - Use your imagination and a few cotton balls to make a fun bunny pal!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: May 23
item.description:
Sing a Song

Farm Animals

A cow goes moo - its calf goes maa.
A dog goes woof - a sheep goes baa-aa.
A pig goes grunt - a chicken goes cluck.
Neigh goes a horse - quack goes a duck!
A cat goes meow - its kitten goes mew.
And a rooster crows cock-a-doodle-doo!

Watch

Nubian Goat

{wmvremote}http://web3.scetv.org/instant_replay/zoomin_goat.wmv{/wmvremote}

Nubian Goat

Try This

Dance together to songs with animals in the title like Hound Dog or The Lion Sleeps Tonight.

TumbleBooks

Dolphins - James De Medeiros

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Make a Goat Windsock - You can make a gruff goat to hang up or put on a stick for a puppet.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: May 22
item.description:
Sing a Song

Slow Sloth’s Slow Song

I……. am …………. a………….sloth…………
a……….sloth………am………..I………………
I……….live………..in………….trees……….
But…….I……….can’t……….fly…………..
I………..do………not………….run………….
I………..am………..so…………slow………..
But……I…………am………where…………
I………want………to…………go………….

Watch

Sea Turtles and Hatchlings

Try This

Have your child draw a picture of a turtle and tell a story about it.

TumbleBooks

When Turtle Grew Feathers - Tim Tingle

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Turtle Coloring Page - Print and color a friendly sea turtle.
  • Meet Our Animals: Delta Swamp - Here at the aquarium, you can meet lots of different animals that live in or near the water.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: May 21
item.description:
Jungle Walk

Act out the animals as you chant and keep the song going with lots of other jungle animals.

Walking through the jungle what did I see?
A big striped TIGER was GROWLING at me!
Walking through the jungle what did I see?
A green ALLIGATOR was SNAPPING at me!

TumbleBooks

Animals in Camouflage - Phyllis Limbacher Tildes

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

What animals live in the jungle? Do you know what sounds they make?

Watch

Brown Bear, Brown Bear, What Do You See?

Explore More

  • Creature Feature: Tigers - Learn more about tigers, see picture, watch a video of a tiger bath, and more!
  • Edward in the Jungle - Edward finds himself in the jungle with Tarzan. What animals does he meet?
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: May 20
item.description:
Sing a Song

What Do the Farm Animals Say

Tune: Mary Had a Little Lamb

Little pigs say oink, oink, oink,
Oink, oink, oink, oink, oink, oink,
Little pigs say oink, oink, oink,
Oink, oink all day long.

Repeat: Baby cows say moo, moo, moo
Horses gallop all around
Chickens scramble for food and dust
Lamb say baa and run around
Kittens meow and chase the mice
Doggies bark and chase the cows
Roosters crow and eat the corn
Goats all butt and maah, maah, maah

Watch

Over in the Meadow

Try This

With your child, practice the sounds that animals make. Talk about which ones your child likes.

TumbleBooks

Caillou & Gilbert - Joceline Sanschagrin

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Farm Animal Coloring Pages - Here are coloring pages for lots of different animals. Help your child cut the animals out and tape them on straws or pencils for instant puppets.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: May 19
item.description:
The Quiet Mouse

Make up a fingerplay to The Quiet Mouse.

Once there lived a quiet mouse.
He lived inside a quiet house.
When all was quiet as could be
OUT POPPED HE!

TumbleBooks

A Home for Pearl Squirrel - Amy Crane Johnson

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Play Which is Bigger? using animals.

Watch

Leading to Reading: The Fox and the Grapes

Explore More

  • Maisy’s Morning on the Farm - Look at the pictures and get a grown-up to help read this story of Maisy the mouse on a busy farm.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: May 18
item.description:
Sing a Song

 

The cow in the barn goes moo, moo, moo
Moo, moo, moo, moo, moo, moo
The cow in the barn goes moo, moo, moo
All day long.

Try more lyrics!
The chickens in the coop go peck, peck, peck...
The geese on the farm go honk, honk, honk...
The turkey in the pen goes gobble, gobble, gobble...
The duck in the pond goes quack, quack, quack...
The pig in the pen goes oink, oink, oink...

Watch

Farm Animal Song

Try This

Sing Old MacDonald Had a Farm. Sing the song with as many animals as you and your child can think of!

TumbleBooks

Ma, I'm A Farmer - Michael Martchenko

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Welcome to the Funky Farm - Meet all the animals on the funky farm!
  • Squealy Scholar - Find out what happens when a smart pig comes to school.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: May 17
item.description:
Baby Kangaroo

Jump, jump, jump goes the big kangaroo
I thought there was one but I see there are two
The mother takes her young one along in a pouch
Where he can nap like a child on a couch

TumbleBooks

For Just One Day - Laura Leuck

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Together, write a poem about your pet or what your favorite animal does all day.

Watch

Story Blocks: Soft Kitty, Warm Kitty

Explore More

  • Kangaroo Coloring Pages - Here are several pages that you can print out to color. What color will your kangaroos be?
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: May 16
item.description:
Sing a Song

Mother Goose Time!

Dickery, dickery, dare,
The pig flew up in the air:
The man in brown,
Soon brought him down,
Dickery, dickery, dare.

Make up some hand motions!

Watch

Elephants Lullaby in Danish

Elephants Lullaby in Danish

Try This

Let’s pretend. Start with E words: elephants, eagles, and eggs. Can you think of other E words?

TumbleBooks

Marsupial Sue - John Lithgow

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Toilet Paper Roll Elephant Craft - Draw an elephant or use this print-out and attach it to a toilet paper roll for a quick and easy elephant puppet.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: May 15
item.description:
Sing a Song

Five Little Butterflies

Five little butterflies by the door.
One flew away, then there were four.

Four little butterflies by the tree.
One flew away, then there were three.

Three little butterflies up in the blue.
One flew away, then there were two.

Two little butterflies out in the sun.
One flew away, then there was one.

One little butterfly now all alone.
She was so lonely, she flew home.

TumbleBooks

The Bumblebee Queen - April Pulley Sayre

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Make a poster together about insects and bugs. Don’t forget to include colorful ones like ladybugs and butterflies.

Watch

PBS Kids: Dragonflies

Explore More

  • Paper Plate Ladybug Puppet - Use paper plates or cut out a semi-circle of paper to make these easy and fun puppets. Can you make a skit with two ladybugs?
  • Make a Bug Hat - Everyone can be a different bug with a nifty bug hat!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: May 14
item.description:
The Bear Went Over The Mountain

The bear went over the mountain
The bear went over the mountain
The bear went over the mountain
To see what he could see.
And all that he could see
And all that he could see
Was the other side of the mountain
The other side of the mountain
The other side of the mountain
Was all that he could see.

Watch

The Bear Went Over the Mountain

Try This

Can you visit the library? Check out books and music about animals. Also look for books by Mo Willems.

TumbleBooks

I’m a Manatee - John Lithgow

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Polar Bear Toss - Song along with this funny song.
  • The Animal Fair - Not just an art project, turn a tissue box into a game. Perfect for a rainy day!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: May 13
item.description:
Sing a Song

Flutter Flutter Butterfly

(fly around like a butterfly)

Flutter, flutter butterfly
floating in the summer sky
Floating by for all to see
floating by so merrily
Flutter, flutter butterfly
floating in the summer sky.

TumbleBooks

Dinosaurs Roar, Butterflies Soar! - Bob Barner

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Take a walk with your child and look for butterflies. Can you tell a story about what you think the butterflies are doing?

Watch

PBS Kids: Five Senses Jive

Explore More

  • Butterfly Fingerprints - Use this easy art project to make butterflies of lots of different colors.
  • Creature Feature: Monarch Butterflies - Learn more about this common butterfly, see pictures, watch a video, and more!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: May 12
item.description:
This little bunny has pink eyes.
This little bunny is very wise.
This little bunny is soft as silk.
This little bunny is white as milk.
This little bunny nibbles away
At cabbages and carrots every day.

Watch

Finger Plays: Elephant

Finger Plays: Elephant

Try This

Together, make a list of animals found in words like coward, catastrophe, or crabby.

TumbleBooks

Jessie’s Island - Sheryl McFarlane

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Video about Elephants - Watch this video with an elephant and her baby. Can you pretend to be an elephant?
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: May 11
item.description:
Sing a Song

Monkey See, Monkey Do

Sing to the Monkey See, Monkey Do song. Can you think of lots of actions to do as a monkey?

Monkey see, monkey do
Little monkey in the zoo.
Monkey, monkey, in the tree
Can you jump around like me?

Also …swing your tail, clap your hands,
nod your head, etc.

TumbleBooks

Pigs - Robert Munsch

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Together, pretend to be big zoo animals and little zoo animals.

Watch

Leading to Reading: Zoo

Explore More

  • The City Zoo - Click on the Read it to Me button to hear the silly story about the animals at the city zoo.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: May 10
item.description:
Sing a Song

Ten Galloping Horses

Ten galloping horses came through town,
(Hold up ten fingers and pretend to gallop)
Five were white and five were brown.
Hold up five and five.
They galloped up and galloped down.
Gallop them up and down.
Ten galloping horses came through town.

Watch

South Carolina State Symbols

Try This

Our state bird is the Carolina Wren and the state dog is a Boykin Spaniel. Draw a picture of what you think these animals look like.

TumbleBooks

The Clever Boy and the Terrible, Dangerous Animal - Idries Shah

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • South Carolina Coloring Page - Print and color this coloring page with our state flag, state reptile, and state fruit!
  • Dexter Robin Learns to Fly - Dexter is scared to learn to fly and leave the nest. Listen to the story to find out what happens next.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: May 9
item.description:
The Itsy Bitsy Spider

Sing The Itsy Bitsy Spider with your child. Do the hand motions. Talk about how spiders spin webs.

The itsy bitsy spider
Went up the water spout
('Climb' up arm)
Down came the rain
(Wiggle fingers down from head to waist)
And washed the spider out
(Throw arms to sides)
Out came the sun and dried up all the rain
(Raise hands above head, make circle for sun)
And the itsy bitsy spider
Went up the spout again.

TumbleBooks

Ace Lacewing: Bug Detective - David Biedrzycki

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

What Do You Suppose?
What do you suppose?
a bee sat on my nose!
(Put finger on nose)
Then what do you think?
He gave me a wink
(Wink)
And said “I beg your pardon,
I thought you were a garden!”
(Open your hands in apology)

Watch

PBS Kids: Spider Crab

Explore More

  • Spider Climbing Waterspout Craft - You can make this spider and then act out The Itsy Bitsy Spider or Little Miss Muffet.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: May 8
item.description:
Five Little Pigs

Five little pigs went out to play.
The first little pig said,
"Let's go to the woods today."
The second little pig said,
"What will we do there?"
The third little pig said,
"We'll look for our mother."
The fourth little pig said,
"What will we do when we find her?"
"We'll hug her and kiss her and kiss her!"
Said the fifth little pig.

TumbleBooks

I Love Saturdays y Domingos - Alma Flor Ada

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Help your child make a card for Mother’s Day — you can include grandmothers or godmothers, or friends’ mothers.

Watch

Happy Mother’s Day, Dear Dragon

Explore More

  • Mother’s Day Handprint and Poem - Mothers and other special people in your life will cherish this personalized handprint craft with poem.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: May 7
item.description:
Sing a Song

Ten Galloping Horses

Ten galloping horses came through the town.
Five were white and five were brown.
They galloped up and they galloped down;
Ten galloping horses came through the town.

Watch

Finger Plays: Beehive

Beehive

Try This

Get out  play dough for your child and make animals or insects together. If you need the recipe, try our Arts & Crafts section below.

TumbleBooks

Mason Moves Away - Amy Crane Johnson

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • The Three Billy Goats Gruff - Listen to the story of a family of goats and a big, ugly troll.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: May 6
item.description:
Sing a Song

The Ants Go Marching

The ants go marching one by one, hurrah, hurrah
The ants go marching one by one, hurrah, hurrah
The ants go marching one by one,
The little one stops to suck his thumb
And they all go marching down around the town
BOOM! BOOM! BOOM!

The ants go marching two by two, hurrah, hurrah
The ants go marching two by two, hurrah, hurrah
The ants go marching two by two,
The little one stops to tie his shoe
And they all go marching down around the town
BOOM! BOOM! BOOM!

Continue counting and rhyming or click to see remaining verses

TumbleBooks

item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: May 5
item.description:
Five Little Squirrels

Five little squirrels lived up in a tree.
And they were alike as squirrels could be.
The first little squirrel was alone one day.
He called to his friends, "Come on and play!"
The second little squirrel jumped down from a limb.
The first little squirrel jumped after him.
The third little squirrel found nuts to eat.
He cracked them and ate them for they were sweet.
The fourth little squirrel played hide and seek.
She hid her eyes and did not peek.
The fifth little squirrel called, "Chirr-chirr-chirr-eeee!"
And all of the squirrels ran back to the tree.

TumbleBooks

item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: May 4
item.description:
Little Toad

I am a little toad.
Hopping down the road.
(hop up and down)
Just listen to my song.
(make ribbit noises)
I sleep all winter long
(palms together on check)
When spring comes, I peep out,
(peep behind hands)
and then I jump about
(jump around)
and now I catch a fly
(clap hands)
and now I wink my eye.
(wink)
and now and then I hop.
(hop)
and now and then I stop.
(sit down)

item.title: May 3
item.description:
This is the Way the Farmer Rides

This is the way the farmer
rides, the farmer rides,
the farmer rides.
This is the way
the farmer rides,
So early in the morning.

Try This

Pretend to be dogs and cats with your child. What kind of sounds do these animals make?

item.title: May 2
item.description:
Sing a Song

Did You Ever

Tune: Did You Ever See A Lassie

Did you ever see a brown bear, a brown bear, a brown bear
Did you ever see a brown bear, catching a fish
Did you ever see a polar bear, polar bear, polar bear
Did you ever see a polar bear, going for a swim
Did you ever see my teddy bear, teddy bear, teddy bear
Did you ever see my teddy bear, taking a nap

Watch

In the Ocean Video

Try This

Help your child count the number of animals you can find on packaging, clothing, or other things in your home.

item.title: May 1
item.description:
Sing a Song

The Penguin Song

Penguin, penguin flap your little wings!
Penguin, penguin flap your little wings!
Chasing fish you swim all day,
You can't fly, but that's OK.
Penguin, penguin flap your little wings!

Watch

What Kind of Animal

Try This

Make an animal collage

Together, cut out pictures of animals or draw pictures and paste them on a big piece of paper.
